subject: Re: [junit] Classpath troubleshooting JUnit 3.8.1, Redhat 9,  JDK 1.4.1_02/01
msgSnippet: ... AllTests is not in the .jar; it s shipped as loose class files inside the JUnit directory. Good luck. J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software
messageBody:
>So said texanworker on 2003-05-29 --------------------
>I installed Redhat 9, junit 3.8.1, and two JDK's -- 1.4.1 versions 01
>and 02.
>
>Regardless of how I set classpath, the TestRunner will run and
>find no classes.
>
>It is puzzling that junit.jar can be found in order to run the
>TestRunner class, but it cannot find the junit.samples.AllTests
>class.

AllTests is not in the .jar; it's shipped as loose class files inside the JUnit directory.

Good luck.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
